## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
 
symptoms <- data.frame("brand" = c("Shows Symptoms","Silent Carriers"),
            "share" = c(.75,.25))
                        
# Create a basic bar
pie = ggplot(symptoms, aes(x="", y=share, fill=brand)) + geom_bar(stat="identity", width=1)
 
# Convert to pie (polar coordinates) and add labels
pie = pie + coord_polar("y", start=0) + geom_text(aes(label = paste0(round(value*100), "%")), position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5))
 
# Add color scale (hex colors)
pie = pie + scale_fill_manual(values=c("Gray", "Red"))
 
# Remove labels and add title
pie = pie + labs(x = NULL, y = NULL, fill = NULL, title = "Covid-19", subtitle = "25% of Infected People Are Silence Carriers")
 
# Tidy up the theme
pie = pie + theme_classic() + theme(axis.line = element_blank(),
          axis.text = element_blank(),
          axis.ticks = element_blank(),
          plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, color = "#666666"))
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
